WorkItem.ClosedComment: this should be fixed in develop after checkin: http://typescript.codeplex.com/SourceControl/changeset/df06bfdd8612
WorkItem.Description:
Calling `tsc file.js` when `file.js` does exist in the correct location causes `tsc` to throw an error.

Error reading file "file.js": File not found

This is misleading since "file.js" actually does exist in the expected location. It appears that `tsc` only accepts input files that have the `.ts` extension. The error should be changed to state the actual problem.
WorkItem.Summary: Passing a .js file to `tsc` as an input causes a misleading "file not found" error.

Comments.Message: I saw this too, it should take regular js files and output declaration files for them... That's what I'd expect when feeding it a js file.
